net.proteusframework.ui.mcolumn

Class MColumnTreeModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.AbstractTreeModel
      • net.proteusframework.ui.mcolumn.MColumnTreeModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TreeModel

    public abstract class MColumnTreeModel
extends AbstractTreeModel
    TreeModel that defines it's columns with the MTreeColumn interface. Implementers must define the root of the tree and how to obtain the children that represent the paths of the tree. Also, the method sortColumn(..) must be implemented.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)
    See Also:
    MTreeColumn

        public boolean canColumnSort(int columnIndex)
        Description copied from class: AbstractTreeModel
        Returns false. Determine if a column can be sorted. Sorting must be implemented in a subclass, the Tree will not perform sorting.
        Specified by:
        canColumnSort in interface TreeModel
        Overrides:
        canColumnSort in class AbstractTreeModel
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.
        Returns:
        true if the column can be sorted, false otherwise.

      • getValueAt

        public final Object getValueAt(TreePath path,
                int columnIndex)
        Description copied from class: AbstractTreeModel
        Returns the last component of the path if the column index is zero, otherwise returns null. Returns the value for the cell at columnIndex and path. Column zero should return an object that is either the same or equal to the object returned by getChild() or equivalently path. getLastPathComponent().
        Specified by:
        getValueAt in interface TreeModel
        Overrides:
        getValueAt in class AbstractTreeModel
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the node.
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.
        Returns:
        The value object.

      • setOrderedColumn

        public final void setOrderedColumn(int columnIndex,
                    SortOrder order)
        Description copied from class: AbstractTreeModel
        Does nothing. Sets the column for ordering and an explicit order mode. If the model does not support this, an empty implementation is sufficient. However, no sorting will be performed.
        Specified by:
        setOrderedColumn in interface TreeModel
        Overrides:
        setOrderedColumn in class AbstractTreeModel
        Parameters:
